snippet: Buyout firms in Europe are hustling for cash. | A cellphone deal is turning up the heat on Sprint. | Campaign ads are focusing on ties to Wall Street, no matter how thin. | Andrew Ross Sorkin said the private equity world had more money than it knew...
abstract: Buyout firms in Europe are hustling for cash. | A cellphone deal is turning up the heat on Sprint. | Campaign ads are focusing on ties to Wall Street, no matter how thin. | Andrew Ross Sorkin said the private equity world had more money than it knew what to do with. A look back on our reporting of the past week's highs and lows in finance.

headline.main: Week in Review: Private Equity Firms Counting Cash
